title: (x) Vintage "Greetings from..." postcards - various alternatives {Stephen}
content:
hi folks,  
anybody have an ID or similar suggestion for the classic greetings from postcards. please see pic for examples.  
many thanks in advance,  
//charles

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontID.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003042/http:/typophile.com/files/fontID_1.jpg) | 81.24 KB |
author: chibasan

comments.content:
Oddly enough, I have been working on a font inspired by those same cheesy postcards, although it more closely resembles Futura Display on steroids. I've been dragging my feet finishing it, because I think there's probably a pretty limited demand for this kind of thing.

Here's what it looks like so far...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003042im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Souvenir-Postcard_6583.gif)

Another of my fonts that might be useful for the same purpose, and _is_ actually finished, is [Jampact](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003042/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jampact-nf/).

Nice work, NIck! I think there's always demand for legible display fonts that are as black as possible.

The 'C' and 'G' could use even more steroids. The 'F' is too narrow.
Forgot to add Jim Parkinson's [FF Matinee Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003042/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.10464.2.9).
